page.title: 05HOME FARM - GRAIN
page.content:
500 acres of the farm is down to grain, made up of: a) 30 acres winter wheat, variety Aquila, used for animal feed. b) 220 acres winter barley, variety Igri, used for animal feed. c) 250 acres spring barley comprise several varieties, principally Goldmarker, Gold and new varieties planted experimentally. If successful their acreage will be increased next year. Again, this grain is for animal feed, and some will be used on the farm. The crop will be dried at New Rent and Whitrigg farms, and sold mostly to local animal feed manufacturers and some exported.
A little seed grain is produced for use on the farm the following year after being cleaned and dressed.
